comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: She was due to depart four days later at 11am on 14/11/1923 for Melbourne, Fremantle, Durban, Cape Town, Teneriffe, Southampton, Hull, and London. Saloon to London - from 92 pounds (about $5,935 now) Third Class to London - from 37 pounds (about $2,390 now) From advert SMH 12/11/1923 p.1, col.3 "Aberdeen Line" - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16105361 Equivalent values via www.measuringworth.com/ukcompare/

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Cheers Beachcomber - measuringworth.com is a find!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Yes, I often look up old prices with it, and sometimes post a comment.  You have to be a bit careful with which of the five values you use - I used the retail price index here, and thought the current worth rather low - like a modern airfare - until I remembered it was one way, not return as the airfare.
